definitions.definition: to take place at the same time

examples.text: It's a pity our trips to New York don't coincide.
The strike was timed to coincide with the party conference.
The singer's arrival was timed to coincide with the opening of the festival.

definitions.definition: to be the same or very similar

examples.text: The interests of employers and employees do not always coincide.
Her story coincided exactly with her brother's.
Our views on this issue coincide closely with yours.
Our views on this issue coincide closely with those of the Countryside Council.

definitions.definition: to meet; to share the same space

examples.text: At this point the two paths coincide briefly.
The present position of the house coincides with that of an earlier dwelling.

wordOrigin: early 18th cent. (in the sense ‘occupy the same space’): from medieval Latin coincidere, from co- ‘together with’ + incidere ‘fall upon or into’.
